title: Individual Canadian Cigarettes to Be Labeled With Health Warnings
description: Tobacco companies must soon label individual cigarettes sold in the country with a health warning, in what Canada is calling a global first.

title: Russia Denounces West Over Drone Strike on Moscow
description: Kremlin officials said Ukraine’s allies should have condemned the strike, and argued again that its real war was with the West.

title: Rishi Sunak Is Still Haunted by Boris Johnson and Liz Truss
description: Boris Johnson’s misadventures still make headlines, but Prime Minister Rishi Sunak’s bigger problem is high inflation and soaring bond yields reminiscent of those that toppled Liz Truss.

title: U.S. Adds Aid to Ukraine to Deliver Ammunition for Drones and Artillery
description: The move to send $300 million in additional support comes as Moscow has come under drone attacks in recent days.

title: As Iran Seizes Tankers, UAE Pulls Back From US-Led Maritime Force
description: The United Arab Emirates announced it had stopped participating in the security group after Iran seized two tankers in the Persian Gulf recently.

title: Readers in Asia: What Does L.G.B.T.Q. Life Look Like Where You Live?
description: We may include your response in a June edition of the Asia Pacific Morning Briefing.

title: Germany Closes Four of Its Five Russian Consulates After Moscow Dispute
description: Berlin responds to the Kremlin limiting the number of German diplomatic staff allowed in Russia.

title: Fear Sets In Among Turkey’s L.G.B.T. Community After Erdogan’s Attacks
description: President Recep Tayyip Erdogan vilified gay people during his re-election campaign, calling them a threat to society and rallying conservatives against them. It has left communities feeling threatened, and alone.

title: Climate Change and Russia Spell Trouble for NATO Up North
description: Russia may be having major difficulties in Ukraine, but it remains a vast power in the north and the Arctic, where climate change is opening new sea routes for trade and trouble.

title: How to Lower Deaths Among Women? Give Away Cash.
description: Mortality rates fell by 20 percent among women in countries that began cash transfer programs to the poor. Children also benefited.

title: Sudan’s Army Withdraws From Cease-Fire Talks
description: The move deals a blow to efforts to end the war and deliver humanitarian aid to millions of people nationwide.

title: A Desperate Act Reveals the Dwindling Room for Dissent in India
description: Their protest dispersed, female wrestlers who have accused a powerful official of sexual harassment went to the Ganges intending to throw away their Olympic medals.

title: U.N. Nuclear Agency Sets New Rules for Plant Near Ukraine’s Front Line
description: The guidelines are intended to avert a catastrophe at Europe’s largest nuclear facility, which Russian forces have controlled for over a year.

title: Rise in Sightings of Honeybee Swarms Has U.K. Beekeepers Scrambling
description: It’s swarming season in Britain, with honeybee colonies splitting in half in search of new homes. This year, beekeepers say they are getting an unusually high number of swarm sightings.

title: A Big Day for the Debt Ceiling
description: The bipartisan debt limit deal still isn’t assured of passing.

title: German Court Convicts Left-Wing Group in Attacks Against Far Right
description: A 28-year-old woman and three accomplices were sentenced to prison for their roles in a series of attacks on people they considered neo-Nazis.

title: Israel Called Them ‘Precision’ Strikes. But Civilian Homes Were Hit, Too.
description: Palestinians in Gaza say that Israel’s strikes against Islamic Jihad amount to a collective punishment aimed at making them fearful about who their neighbors might be.

title: South Korea’s False Evacuation Alert Causes Chaos
description: South Koreans said the alert, which was triggered by a North Korean rocket launch, showed that their country was unprepared to respond to a real emergency.

title: India Will Scrap 2,000 Rupee Notes, Echoing 2016 Demonetization
description: The move to retire 2,000-rupee notes, worth $24, has triggered bad memories of a similar campaign in 2016. It has also left some businesses short of change.

title: State Farm Stops Offering Insurance in California
description: The largest insurer in California said it would stop offering new coverage. It’s part of a broader trend of companies pulling back from dangerous areas.

title: State Farm Stops Offering Insurance in California
description: The largest insurer in California said it would stop offering new coverage. It’s part of a broader trend of companies pulling back from dangerous areas.

title: ‘We Have Fish, That’s Our Currency’
description: Along Ireland’s coast, fishing has been a way of life for generations. But changes to the industry — including a cut in quotas after Brexit and a government plan to scrap boats — may see a way of life disappear.

title: Pakistan Courts Challenge Military With High-Profile Rulings
description: Long seen as kowtowing to the military, the judiciary has defied it in recent rulings, signaling an important shift in Pakistan’s political landscape.

title: Your Wednesday Briefing
description: Drone attacks on Moscow.
